chapter_title: MYTH #1: IF I SET BOUNDARIES, I'M BEING SELFISH
summary: The first myth explored in this chapter discusses the misconception that setting boundaries equates to selfishness. Many individuals struggle with this notion, fearing that establishing limits on their time and energy will prioritize their needs over others. However, the authors clarify that healthy boundaries enhance our ability to care for others, contrasting true self-centeredness with responsible stewardship. By openly communicating our boundaries, we create opportunities for healing and authentic relationships. Ultimately, realizing that our needs are our own responsibility is crucial for personal growth and genuine connection with others.

slides.section_body: Myths about boundaries often blur the lines between self-care and selfishness. Many believe that putting oneself first is inherently wrong, especially in faith communities. These misunderstandings can hinder personal development and relationships.
slides.quote: Myth #1: If I set boundaries, I'm being selfish.

slides.section_body: When we hide aspects of ourselves due to fear, we imprison our identities in darkness. Communicating boundaries openly brings us into the light, integrating our personalities and enabling healing.
slides.quote: Healing always takes place in the light.

slides.section_body: God desires truth in our innermost being and encourages authentic relationships based on clear communication. To be real with ourselves and others, we must share our boundaries openly.
slides.quote: God wants real relationship with us.

slides.section_body: Just as God guided his people out of Egypt, we too are called to move from places of dysfunction and alienation. This transition requires learning and practicing divine principles to inhabit our newfound spaces spiritually and emotionally.
slides.quote: What God has secured needs to be possessed.

slides.section_body: True selfishness focuses solely on personal wishes, while stewardship recognizes the importance of balancing our needs and responsibilities towards others. Setting boundaries is an act of stewardship.
slides.quote: Appropriate boundaries increase our ability to care about others.

slides.section_body: God seeks to meet our needs rather than indulge our desires. It is essential to understand that having desires isn't wrong, but they must align with our needs for true fulfillment.
slides.quote: God will meet all your needs according to his glorious riches.

slides.section_body: Meeting our needs is fundamentally our responsibility. We cannot wait for others to decipher and fulfill our needs; we are called to actively pursue our own care.
Many people view their needs as burdensome or selfish. This mentality prevents them from embracing their God-given rights to self-care and responsible living.
slides.quote: Meeting our own needs is basic job. Don't wait passively.

slides.section_body: Setting boundaries is not about ignoring others but rather about acknowledging our limits to foster authentic love and care. Healthy limits empower us to be present for ourselves and those we love.
slides.quote: Healthy boundaries enhance our ability to truly love.

slides.section_body: By learning to set and communicate our boundaries, we can foster healthier connections with others. Our relationships flourish when we honor our own needs and respect others' limits.
slides.quote: Authentic relationships thrive in the light of clear boundaries.
